question: The Vijayanagar kingdom constituted of how many dynasties?
explanation: The Vijayanagar kingdom which was established in 1336 CE in south India consisted of four dynasties — Sangama (c.1336–1485 CE), Saluva (c.1485–1503 CE), Tuluva (c.1503–1570 CE) and Aravidu (till the end of the 17th century).
